content: We dismiss approvals on PRs of rustc-dev-guide by branch protection. But I'm not sure if it's useful here, for example, it's painful when we fix just a typo. do we really need this protection?
Ah, I had forgotten that was a setting we could change
I just disabled it (though I can reenable it if people feel we should or if we see a high rate of accidents)

@Tshepang Lekhonkhobe on github, if you Approve the PR and then I push again, it "dismisses" the approval, meaning that you have to re-approve before it can be merged. Disabling that means that the author can push again without needing re-approval.
